result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel Dean Cousins Sr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:33 AM Court calls case and recites appearances. Judge Angeline Winton appearing from Washburn County by ZOOM. Prosecuting attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daniel Dean Cousins Sr. in court.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for Daniel Dean Cousins Sr. DE advised of rights as to in person appearance in front of Judge.  DE understands and waves right. Court satisfied DE understands right and is knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waiving his right to have Judge Winton in the courtroom. ADA Sortedahl outlines plea agreement. Court goes through plea questionaire and advises DE of rights.  DE waives rights.  Court addresses Atty Chapman.  Atty Chapman has had sufficient time to counsel DE and believes he knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently is waiving his rights.  Court finds DE knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waives rights.  ADA Sortedahl makes arguement for joint agreement.  Requests the Court allow any victims in the courtroom be allowed to address the Court.  Court asks if there are any others in the Sawyer County courtroom.  Clerk informs Judge Winton there are three people in the courtroom, but do not wish to address the Court.  Atty Chapman argues for joint agreement.  DE addresses the Court. Court goes through plea agreement and further rights.  DE waives rights.  Court finds DE  knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waives rights.  Court accepts pleas and prnounces sentence:

22CF54 - Count 1 - DRI, Count 2 - 3 yrs probation w/conditions: 30 days conditional jail time to begin no later than 6/29/2022; no contact with E.S.R. dob: 6/26/1968 and D.R.T. dob 11/16/1968; AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations; ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages. No drug use and may not possess any controlled substance  without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered; No associating with persons using or dealing drugs; Complete any counseling and programming deemed appropriate by agent, and follow through;  DEF must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $200 surcharge. Additional costs in the amount of $ 243.00 for a total of $ 443.00, payable through DOC. 15 days credit if revoked.  Concurrent with: 20CF233 and 20CF234

20CF97 - 3 yr deferred agreement - dismissed if successful, bond continues

20CF233 - Counts 1, 2 & 3: 3 yrs probation w/conditions: 30 days conditional jail time to begin no later than 6/29/2022; no contact with E.S.R. dob: 6/26/1968 and D.R.T. dob 11/16/1968; AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations; ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages. No drug use and may not possess any controlled substance  without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered; No associating with persons using or dealing drugs; Complete any counseling and programming deemed appropriate by agent, and follow through;  DEF must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $200 surcharge. Additional costs in the amount of $ 243.00 for a total of $ 443.00, payable through DOC. 15 days credit if revoked.  Concurrent with: 20CF234 and 22CF54

Plea/sentencing hearing on April 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.

03:03 PM Defendant Daniel Dean Cousins in court with attorney Daniel James Chapman appears by video.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.    Judge Angeline Winton appears by video from Washburn County. Court has discussion with DEF regarding DEF having parties appear by zoom, DEF agrees to have parties appear by zoom.   Attny Chapman agrees to accept appointment to case, Court appoints Attny Chapman to case.   DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and address.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.   Through Counsel DEF enters NG Plea to count 2.  State makes bond recommendation.  Attny Chapman no objection.  Court sets bond.  SIBS $1500  No Contact with  E.R.  dob 6/26/1968.  Attny Chapman no preliminary hearing will be needed.   DEF to report to jail for fingerprints.    Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.
